Service Details: - Creates safe and secure futures, in community, for people with disabilities and their families- Prepares families to take the steps necessary for effective future planning by developing a Personal Future Plan for loved ones with disabilities- Provides assistance in developing and expanding a network of friends and supporters committed to the person with a disability (the person at the centre or focus person), contributing to their quality of life now and in the future when parents are not there through the Personal Network Program- Provides workshops and information on the Registered Disability Savings Plan (RDSP), Will, Trust, and Estate planning, home ownership and alternatives to legal guardianship- Offers Families to Families Network where families are welcome to participate in a relaxed and informal gather to discuss a variety of topics- Advocates on behalf of individuals and families
Meetings: Family to Family, last Thu of each month at 7:00pm at 1650 Bernard Ave (House at Burch and Bernard)- No meeting in August or December- All are welcome
Address & Map: 1650 Bernard AveKelowna, BC     V1Y 6R9View MapQuest Map
